Job Posting:172329 - Position: W26 SW Tools Development Co-op/Intern 172329 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Winter App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 09/08/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 08/28/2025 03:36 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Country Nokia Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description 2026 - Winter W26 SW Tools Development Co-op/Intern 172329 Co-op Position Ottawa, ON Canada 4 months Hybrid CAD Salary Not Available, 0 Major List $41,184 to $96,356 CAD per year SW Tools Development Co-op/Intern 24035 Position: Software Tools Development Co-op/Intern Number of Position(s): 1 Duration: 4 Months Date: Jan 5th, 2026 to Apr 24th, 2026 Location: Flexible HOW YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE AND WHAT YOU WILL LEARN As a part of our team, you will: • Work with a small, talented development team learning Proligent Analytics • Write scripts to automate test tools Document all problems and solutions • About Us Come create the technology that helps the world act together Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people's lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world. We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work What we offer Nokia offers continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered. Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality: • One of the World's Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere • Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg Workplace Pride Global Benchmark • At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. Nokia's employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect. Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed. Job Requirements EDUCATIONAL RECOMMENDATIONS Currently a candidate for a Bachelor's degree or diploma in Computer Science, Computer Systems Engineering, Software Engineering, or a related field with an accredited school in Canada. KEY SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE • Strong programming skills • Enthusiasm for software development and solving problems The ability to ask questions and express your ideas and point of view clearly is KEY • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Application Link: https://fa-evmr- saasfaprod1.fa.ocs.oraclecloud.com/hcmUI/CandidateExperience/en/sites/CX_1/job/24035?utm_medium=jobshare&src=SNS-102 Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
